@kek608 @Dr_RShatsky Jesus is actually God himself. The Holly trinity...

@Dr_RShatsky I usually say that God operates his miracles through others (Jesus, Noah, etc) and that I would like to participate in the patient's miracle.

I know its not an accurate take on the bible but sometimes it works.

Eu raramente posto algo de politica aqui, mas confesso que eu to morrendo de rir do cara inventando desculpa por estar na Copa por causa de PenDrive. 

Nao to acreditando... kkkkkkkkkkkkkkkkkkk

@pauliec80859931 @AaronGoodman33 @GomezDLeonMD @matthew_mei @MediHumdani @Lymphoma_Doc @BijoyTelivala @WolverHeme @hematologo @AnnaSureda5 @graham74GC HSTCL is an extremely rare lymphoma. In my small cohort of patients, none had IBD, although one had autoimmune hepatitis. 

In the literature, there is a composite risk of thiopurines and Anti-TNF. I cannot give you numbers but the risk is really low.

@matthew_mei @ajperissinotti @GomezDLeonMD @AaronGoodman33 @MediHumdani @Lymphoma_Doc @BijoyTelivala @WolverHeme @hematologo @AnnaSureda5 @graham74GC @annabrown915 @VictoriaNachar I have never used asparaginase in HSTCL.
I have used in refractory MEITL after 5 lines with no response.

@mario_pathology I have moved from Goiás (3 kisses) to São Paulo (1 kiss).

Rio de Janeiro's cariocas use 2 Kisses and there is also some trouble when we meet.

😗😗😗 https://t.co/8gJ8s0vwpF

data.text:
#PeriniPicks No. 7 for #ASH22 

A huge international effort to evaluate how different populations with ATLL behave (n=837!): 
https://t.co/qjABXWca7t

Congrats to all friends from @GELL01433166 @Denicasuri @CamiPenaO @FiadLorena and others! 1st oral presentation of many to come!

@GomezDLeonMD Yes, probably. Challenging though!
We will have a inhouse CarT program. I'll let you know how it goes...

@GomezDLeonMD @AaronGoodman33 @matthew_mei @MediHumdani @Lymphoma_Doc @BijoyTelivala @WolverHeme @hematologo @AnnaSureda5 @graham74GC Take him to Allo directly.
Hard to treat and also hard to evaluate response.
If spleen too big, I could consider Rtx or further treatment with Belinostat (what I have avaliable here).

If not, Straight to allo! Chemo Just wont do it.
I always tell my fellows exactly the same... https://t.co/JubQ6W8rts

If I had to put my money on a winning strategy for LMIC, I would choose biespecifics. 
Not only for lymphomas, but also for MM. 
Easier, off the shell, accessible to different regions/centers. 
Not a perfect Tx, and price will be an issue. 

Longer F/U needed, though.

data.text:
#PeriniPicks No. 8 for #ASH22 
CarTs are going to be a challenge in LMIC, including prices, logistics, burocracy. 

An option seems to be bispecifics. 
And the data on Glofitamab looks really good, with long responses after a finite therapy: 

https://t.co/cFssiewpDj
@nihardesai7 Both is not an option?
@Mohty_EBMT @TheIACH @ASH_hematology Brazilian people are the best! 🎶🎶🎶
@hemepathguy Beautiful!

@drjgauthier Great album!
Autumn leaves my favourite!

There is no Life experience as being in Brazil for a World Cup Game.

At #ASH22, if you want to have a glimpse of that, join us Brazilians for a game. 

You wont regret! 🍻

Its all about followers...

I could never imagine people would be celebrating and pointing fingers when a drug fail.

We should always be extremely rigorous with data, but never forget we are dealing with people who could benefit from the drug. 

The drug has not failed.
We have failed our patients.

#PeriniPicks No.9 - Dont add extra costs for ASCT in lymphomas.
https://t.co/tbyjTdO33D

Randomized ph2 trial comparing BEAM x BeEAM shows same results. A little bit more pulmonary toxicity on the BEAM arm, but not stat significant. 

Important data for LMIC countries!
Also true for Brazil and LatAm! https://t.co/sVK2PVQOAp

Great data showing that at least in DLBCL, we are close to reality in Clinical trials. 

So lets criticize less and do more trials!
Especially in LMIC, please!

#PeriniPicks No. 10
Abst 1639
How Relevant Are the Control Cohorts of Clinical Trials in Patients with Newly Diagnosed DLBCL in a Daily Practice?

Great work showing that control arms of ND DLBCL studies have similar outcomes of real-life DLBCL that fullfill IC/EC of these trials

Ok, let's start it because the World Cup is almost starting...

#PeriniPicks for #ASH22! Lymphoma Abstracts focusing on impact of therapy in LMIC. No fancy drugs, no crazy stuff.

@ASkarbnik Just finished going through all lymphoma abstracts for my #PeriniPicks. 

Overdose of abstracts leads to stupid searches.

What does that mean?

Probably Nothing.

Acalabrutinib - 75
Zanubrutinib - 45
Pirtobrutinib - 17
Nemtabrutinib - 3

tweets.text:
Great question. We analyzed this in our review: https://t.co/ItDybSIgt0

Definite diagnostic challenges, like w/ grey zone lymphoma (aka intermediate b/t DLBCL & cHL, etc).

And even if definitive diagnosis of HGBL-NOS, unclear re: optimal Rx but know most pts do poorly w/ RCHOP. https://t.co/PClAO9jfuK https://t.co/28dgiesTp9

@ASkarbnik @DrAEvens Similar views do not help my #HealthcareUnfiltered podcast. Please disagree moving forward.

But indeed, the paper made me think of what would we do w MYC+ DLBCL & HGLBL; (non-BL); I’m not sure we know how best to treat MYC only HGLBL, but suspect most would intensify Tx.

Hey #MedTwitter !!

Before you belittle a speciality, remember, clinical medicine can't possibly survive w/o microbiology, pathology, biochemistry etc 🙏🏻

@AaronGoodman33 @matthew_mei Well, wouldn’t it be a similar conundrum then? Who’s to say here that RCHOP/RDHAP without ASCT consolidation followed by R maintenance/observation and ibrutinib given only at relapse isn’t similar in OS to using Ibr maintenance?

@GuiperiniMD @ManniMD1 SMM patient perspective here: it’s true, pts not enrolled unwillingly. But “knowing” in this context (I.e., the info used to make decision, often at a time of great stress) is quite challenging for pts, and many rely on Dr advice. So do all pts really “know?”
Well, Jack white is mesmerizing. A freakin phenomenon. Jack White es un fenómeno. Toque perfecto! @RockaDomicilioP @marchenajr @onorosaurosrex https://t.co/vQhDS8RNls https://t.co/tPbdTaypbz
Phoenix en vivo es brutal! Phoenix live is brutal! Increíble. @RockaDomicilioP @marchenajr https://t.co/s2XClAbXMH https://t.co/Gi62soxFAC
@ASkarbnik @chadinabhan @GuiperiniMD Messi is looking unstoppable….
@AaronGoodman33 @GuiperiniMD @chadinabhan I think a piano or keyboard will be really easy to find in New Orleans!
@GuiperiniMD @ManniMD1 That's part of why I love #mmsm; to see these debates and learn more about all the options and the studies and opinions that inform how drs treat. Sorry to ramble. 4/4
@AaronGoodman33 @GuiperiniMD Can I be there in case the exchange turns violent?
@chadinabhan @GuiperiniMD I am a peaceful man unless Dr P says Pearl Jam is superior to Nirvana.
@GuiperiniMD I won’t let this go.  You can mute me if it annoys you too much.
@GuiperiniMD Second side of Abbey Road. Do we really have to do this? 😉
@RahulBanerjeeMD We better check before assuming such code does not exist! 🤣
@GuiperiniMD Appreciate your input and sharing that. I don’t think you are “correcting” something wrong I have said, but you context is helpful.
@ManniMD1 @GuiperiniMD I think prior to consent the doc should swallow a selinexor pill as they are presumably asymptomatic also.  A week later they can do the consent appropriately.

Those with intermediate risk smoldering myeloma according to 2/20/20 have a 18% chance of progression at 2 years.

Should they be enrolled in a single arm small (n=15) trial of a drug with a much higher likelihood of severe toxicity (relative to risk of progression)?

#mmsm https://t.co/F51Xc7ZuI3
@GuiperiniMD Abbey Road B side
@GuiperiniMD Maybe, you didn’t realize that In My Life and all these others songs are on the Rubber Soul B-side. https://t.co/Kfle0dNfHI
@GuiperiniMD 2112 - Rush

What is your favourite B-side of a Record?

I have no doubt it is Magical Mistery Tour:
Hello Goodbye
Strawberry fields Forever
Penny Lane
Baby you're a rich Man
All you need is Love
É uma pena que estejamos gastando dinheiro com colégios e não em tratamentos pro Neymar melhorar logo.

I have been told it cruel to observe smoldering myeloma as patients will develop broken hips and backs.  I don't want this to happen!  

Show me data treating prevents this (as opposed to PET+ bone lesion or Hb 10) and I will be glad to start treating smoldering myeloma.
Hey Attendings, if you were asked “where do you see yourself in 10 years” during residency interviews (like I’ve been asked), how close are you to your answer? #MedTwitter

urls.title: Paper: Relapse Is Uncommon in Patients with Large B-Cell Lymphoma Who Are in Complete Remission at the End of Fixed-Course Glofitamab Treatment
urls.description: Program: Oral and Poster Abstracts Type: Oral Session: 626. Aggressive Lymphomas: Prospective Therapeutic Trials: Immune Based and Targeted Therapies in Relapsed/Refractory Large B-Cell Lymphoma Hematology Disease Topics & Pathways: Biological therapies, non-Hodgkin lymphoma, Lymphomas, Bispecific Antibody Therapy, B Cell lymphoma, Diseases, aggressive lymphoma, Therapies, Lymphoid Malignancies Martin Hutchings, MD, PhD 1 *, Carmelo Carlo-Stella, MD, PhD 2, Franck Morschhauser, MD, PhD 3 *, Emmanuel

tweets.text:
#PeriniPicks No. 8 for #ASH22 
CarTs are going to be a challenge in LMIC, including prices, logistics, burocracy. 

An option seems to be bispecifics. 
And the data on Glofitamab looks really good, with long responses after a finite therapy: 

https://t.co/cFssiewpDj

Question for #hematology fellows !!

23,♂️, stage 4b large B cell lymphoma, GCB type.
🔸FISH: Myc + BCL2 rearranged
🔸CNS IPI 3
🔸LDH 2x ULN

What is your approach w.r.t CNS prophylaxis??

#MedTwitter
@chadinabhan @helops79 @GuiperiniMD @FIFAcom I’m a Mexico fan since I was a little kid 😜😜
Not just hemepath. L - paisley stratocaster UR - blue flower stratocaster LR - set of 1969 Fender Mustangs in competition burgandy, competition orange, and competition red https://t.co/DixFWEcKh7
https://t.co/uQjYqFXb4a

In #ASH22 the question of HD and ASCT consolidation in PCNS lymphoma has been answered. But I have a more practical one about induction. 52 years old female received 2 cycles of R-HD MTX and ARA-C and achieved CMR. Thiotepa arrived at 3rd cycle (#LATAM). Do you switch to Matrix?
@VincentRK I don’t understand the flame wars.  It’s always possible to make a point without being rude or nasty.

urls.title: 64th ASH Annual Meeting and Exposition: Late-Breaking Abstracts Session
urls.description: Hall E (Ernest N. Morial Convention Center) David A. Garcia, MD, University of Washington and Olatoyosi Odenike, MD, University of Chicago No relevant conflicts of interest to declare. This highly anticipated session highlights the Joint Program Committees' selections of the highest-impact ab stracts, featuring substantive, novel, and groundbreaking data that were not available by the general abstract submission deadline and would otherwise not be presented at the ASH annual

tweets.text:
Blinatumomab consolidation plus ALL pediatric regimen RCT ECOG 1910
KM curve looking good 🤩 #ASH22 

https://t.co/x6Wdp0Sv15 https://t.co/cBGVIGCe0X

One of the joys of reviewing abstracts/ writing for @ASH_hematology News Daily is to look across field of hematology and see great work.

Loved seeing collab analysis from Latin America, hope for similar multinat collaborative groups from other areas (esp🇵🇰🇮🇳!)
Some examples 👇
@VexFlexPerplex @GuiperiniMD Benda slightly more in the US but not by much when I asked our pharmacy team
@GuiperiniMD In 🇮🇳, the cost of BCNU and Benda is almost the same !

Spent an hour stuck in traffic 🚦 but I'm not complaining, thanks to the Healthcare Unfiltered podcast  👍🏻 

Super episode staring @DrNikitaMehra and @GuiperiniMD about practising oncology in LMIC.

Thank you @chadinabhan for doing what you do 👍🏻💪🏼

#MedTwitter
The best werewolf transformation ever! https://t.co/StvSn7J5X3

Indian Hematologist should not fall in trap of not doing early transplants advocated by few centre from America. There disease is different there treatment is different and ours is entirely different. Blindly copying will do more disservice to our Pts
@GuiperiniMD Did a transplanter say that?  A little harsh IMO

urls.title: Não Tenho Culpa De Ser Triste

tweets.text:
Kris Kristofferson? Neil Young? Willie Nelson? Ouça essa música e diga se não poderia ter sido gravada por qualquer grande nome da música country. Mas era de Nelson Ned, composta e gravada em 1979...
https://t.co/Hp4N3NVi7P
@tecomedina Zzzzzzzz
@GuiperiniMD Are there any #PeriniPicks for Football World Cup?
@GuiperiniMD Are you certain no Negronis were involved in the decision to count BTKi abstracts? 😜
@GuiperiniMD As a curious (anxious) ex-patient, is there something noteworthy on cHL?

#PeriniPicks No. 10
Abst 1639
How Relevant Are the Control Cohorts of Clinical Trials in Patients with Newly Diagnosed DLBCL in a Daily Practice?

Great work showing that control arms of ND DLBCL studies have similar outcomes of real-life DLBCL that fullfill IC/EC of these trials

Ok, let's start it because the World Cup is almost starting...

#PeriniPicks for #ASH22! Lymphoma Abstracts focusing on impact of therapy in LMIC. No fancy drugs, no crazy stuff.
@GuiperiniMD It means you have a lot of free time to count abstracts, my friend!

BTKi matches in #ASH22 abstracts

Ibrutinib - 212 🏆 
Acalabrutinib - 75
Zanubrutinib - 45
Pirtobrutinib - 17
Nemtabrutinib - 3
@hematologo @GuiperiniMD @rajuan_27 @graham74GC @PerlaRcp Wow never for MCL. Interesante opción. 🤔👍

What is your first-line treatment option for a 75 yo Mantle Cell Lymphoma patient, intermediate MIPI score, p53 unmutated, controlled comorbidities, ECOG 1
@graham74GC @hematologo @GuiperiniMD @PerlaRcp
